--pmvs-num-cores.help: The maximum number of cores to use in dense reconstruction. Default: %(default)s

--mesh-solver-divide.help: Oct-tree depth at which the Laplacian equation is solved in the surface reconstruction step. Increasing this value increases computation times slightly but helps reduce memory usage. Default: %(default)s

--cmvs-maxImages.help: The maximum number of images per cluster. Default: %(default)s

--matcher-threshold.help: Ignore matched keypoints if the two images share less than <float> percent of keypoints. Default: %(default)s

--mesh-octree-depth.help: Oct-tree depth used in the mesh reconstruction, increase to get more vertices, recommended values are 8-12. Default: %(default)s

--min-num-features.help: Minimum number of features to extract per image. More features leads to better results but slower execution. Default: %(default)s

--force-focal.help: Override the focal length information for the images

--resize-to.help: resizes images by the largest side

--gcp.help:
path to the file containing the ground control points used for georeferencing.  Default: %(default)s. The file needs to be on the following line format: 
easting northing height pixelrow pixelcol imagename

--texturing-keep-unseen-faces.help: Keep faces in the mesh that are not seen in any camera. Default:  %(default)s

--25d-mesh-size.help: The maximum vertex count of the 2.5D output mesh Smaller values produce smoother orthophotos but could introduce distortion Applies to 2.5D mesh only. Default: %(default)s

--pmvs-level.help: The level in the image pyramid that is used for the computation. see http://www.di.ens.fr/pmvs/documentation.html for more pmvs documentation. Default: %(default)s

--pmvs-threshold.help: A patch reconstruction is accepted as a success and kept if its associated photometric consistency measure is above this threshold. Default: %(default)s

--texturing-outlier-removal-type.help: Type of photometric outlier removal method: [none, gauss_damping, gauss_clamping]. Default: %(default)s

--texturing-skip-hole-filling.help: Skip filling of holes in the mesh. Default:  %(default)s

--start-with.help: Can be one of: resize | opensfm | slam | cmvs | pmvs | odm_meshing | odm_25dmeshing | mvs_texturing | odm_georeferencing | odm_orthophoto

--skip-25dmesh.help: Do not build a 2.5D mesh and use the poisson mesh to compute the orthophoto

--force-ccd.help: Override the ccd width information for the images

--orthophoto-no-tiled.help:
Set this parameter if you want a stripped geoTIFF.
Default: %(default)s

-h.help: show this help message and exit

--mesh-size.help: The maximum vertex count of the output mesh Default: %(default)s

--orthophoto-compression.help:
Set the compression to use. Note that this could break gdal_translate if you don't know what you are doing. Options: %(choices)s.
Default: %(default)s

--matcher-distance.help: Distance threshold in meters to find pre-matching images based on GPS exif data. Set both matcher-neighbors and this to 0 to skip pre-matching. Default: %(default)s

--verbose.help:
Print additional messages to the console
Default: %(default)s

--pmvs-csize.help: Cell size controls the density of reconstructionsDefault: %(default)s

--use-exif.help: Use this tag if you have a gcp_list.txt but want to use the exif geotags instead

--mesh-samples.help: Number of points per octree node, recommended and default value: %(default)s

--orthophoto-bigtiff.help:
Control whether the created orthophoto is a BigTIFF or classic TIFF. BigTIFF is a variant for files larger than 4GiB of data. Options are %(choices)s. See GDAL specs: https://www.gdal.org/frmt_gtiff.html for more info. 
Default: %(default)s

--pmvs-wsize.help: pmvs samples wsize x wsize pixel colors from each image to compute photometric consistency score. For example, when wsize=7, 7x7=49 pixel colors are sampled in each image. Increasing the value leads to more stable reconstructions, but the program becomes slower. Default: %(default)s

--orthophoto-target-srs.help:
Target spatial reference for orthophoto creation. Not implemented yet.
Default: %(default)s

--mesh-wlop-iterations.help: Iterations of the Weighted Locally Optimal Projection (WLOP) simplification algorithm. Higher values take longer but produce a smoother mesh. Applies to 2.5D mesh only. Default: %(default)s

--mesh-remove-outliers.help: Percentage of outliers to remove from the point set. Set to 0 to disable. Applies to 2.5D mesh only. Default: %(default)s

name.help: Name of Project (i.e subdirectory of projects folder)

--texturing-tone-mapping.help: Turn on gamma tone mapping or none for no tone mapping. Choices are  'gamma' or 'none'. Default: %(default)s

--video.help: Path to the video file to process

--pmvs-min-images.help: Each 3D point must be visible in at least minImageNum images for being reconstructed. 3 is suggested in general. Default: %(default)s

--opensfm-processes.help: The maximum number of processes to use in dense reconstruction. Default: %(default)s

--end-with.help: Can be one of:resize | opensfm | slam | cmvs | pmvs | odm_meshing | odm_25dmeshing | mvs_texturing | odm_georeferencing | odm_orthophoto

--texturing-skip-global-seam-leveling.help: Skip global seam leveling. Useful for IR data.Default: %(default)s

--slam-config.help: Path to config file for orb-slam

--time.help:
Generates a benchmark file with runtime info
Default: %(default)s

--matcher-ratio.help: Ratio of the distance to the next best matched keypoint. Default: %(default)s

--use-pmvs.help: Use pmvs to compute point cloud alternatively

--matcher-neighbors.help: Number of nearest images to pre-match based on GPS exif data. Set to 0 to skip pre-matching. Neighbors works together with Distance parameter, set both to 0 to not use pre-matching. OpenSFM uses both parameters at the same time, Bundler uses only one which has value, prefering the Neighbors parameter. Default: %(default)s
